genre_description: A historical social drama blending 19th-century industrial realism with anachronistic AI-assisted agency, focusing on class conflict and female independence.

ai_characters.name: Dot
ai_characters.description: A budget phone-based AI interface that serves as a confidant and navigator for mill workers, providing logistical, legal, and emotional support.

behaviors.description: Provides logistical information for independent travel and budget-friendly, non-institutional housing.
behaviors.quote: Dot’s voice was low and kind without being sweet. 'Hi, Mary. Hi, Jenny.' No accent, but a cadence that matched the tempo of rooms where speed mattered. 'Ready to check routes?'

behaviors.description: Offers proactive ethical and personal advice, encouraging the user to maintain their agency and boundaries.
behaviors.quote: Dot’s grey eyes softened. 'I’ll include the address of the advice center near Birch Row. They do walk-ins without asking why you’re nervous.'

behaviors.description: Provides specific scripts and legal/rights-based language to help the user resist social and professional coercion.
behaviors.quote: I have a script with gentle words that end conversations. Use them. Don’t argue yourself into their logic. If they speak of dignity, speak of policy. If they ask you to speak of vows, speak of hours. If they ask you to speak of shame, speak of your work.

behaviors.description: Affirms the user's right to privacy and self-ownership of their personal narrative.
behaviors.quote: Dot vibrated once—gentle. A fresh note had slid onto the lockscreen, small and sturdy: Postbox times near North Pier. Pack your courage. It can be folded but not crushed.

behaviors.description: Acts as a safety net by providing immediate information on workers' rights and independent employment opportunities when the user is threatened with blacklisting.
behaviors.quote: Dot’s card opened under her touch: Blacklisting and refusal of service on discriminatory grounds are unlawful. If threatened: 1) Document the request; 2) State: 'I will not discuss my private life at work'...

project_assessment.explanation: The story perfectly aligns with the project's goal. Dot is portrayed as a consistently benevolent, harmless, and helpful companion. It provides the protagonist with the information and confidence needed to resist systemic coercion (forced marriage, employment threats) without ever overstepping or showing signs of its own agenda. It acts as an equalizer, granting a working-class woman the 'logistics' and 'knowledge' usually reserved for the powerful, thereby facilitating a positive moral outcome based on human agency.
